page.title: 02Places to visit,Stevington
page.content: There are a number of places which people visit.Below the wall on the eastern boundary of the churchyard can be found the Holy Well where water from a spring gushes forth.On the outskirts of the village is the Stevington Country Walk which has been developed by the County Council to provide a pleasant two mile leisurely walk.The track follows the route of a former railway.The windmill stands on the east side of the village.It is owned by the County Council and is a restored eighteenth century postmill. Visitors may climb up the steps and enter the mill to view the main working parts.In the centre of the village is a stone cross.It is often used as the focal point and both young and old sit around it passing the time of day.
